claims.claim: Pre-release programs should introduce incarcerated individuals to their support system before release.
claims.quote: Recognizing who the support system is and getting it validated before they come out.

claims.claim: Virtual tools should be utilized to introduce incarcerated individuals to support networks prior to release.
claims.quote: Already had them introduced to it like we're talking now. Virtually they can do that.

claims.claim: Involvement in grassroots organizing can provide purpose and direction for returning citizens.
claims.quote: A good organization or a good group to look at when people come out and they feel like they don't have a skillset is some grassroots organ organizing.

claims.claim: Support networks significantly impact the success of returning citizens.
claims.quote: I know for sure when they got out, they found a support system, something they believed in, and they poured all their time and energy into that.

claims.claim: Free training opportunities should be provided to returning citizens to aid in their reentry.
claims.quote: That training is free, and they're among other people who believe in them.

claims.claim: Being around people who believe in them is crucial for the rehabilitation of returning citizens.
claims.quote: And if we don't have them around, people who believe in them, they're gonna go back into the system.
